intro: Furcraea, commonly known as the sword plant or banana tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the asparagus family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. Furcraea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions. They produce small, white or yellow flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits.
